nodes.bodyText: @findepi we could instead refactor createCoercer to return an Optional object, thoughts?

Let's not add this to SPI. We should add it when it is commonly needed.
This can be just a helper method next to createCoercer

Return Functions.identity() instead for now.
As a followup, yes it makes sense to have createCoercer return Optional.
Then the fromType.equals(toType) check should be moved inside the method.
This should operate on Slice directly.
Add a test case where eg 💰💰💰 (varchar(3)) gets truncated to varchar(2) resulting in 💰💰
the last value is truncating from abc (varchar(3)) to ab (varchar(2)). Could you please elaborate on what you're suggesting here?

The point is -- see https://github.com/prestosql/presto/pull/5530/files#r506265902
You are truncating using String#substring, which is correct for values within Unicode BMP, but not correct for characters encoded in UTF-16 as surrogate pairs. 💰 is an example such character. Current code will probably truncate to 💰 instead of 💰💰.
Got it, will look into it. thanks for the explanation.
"not worth" is not the right term. "is type only" would be more accurate, but i would actually remove the comment.

add
// TODO make the method return Optional
